22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (17:12): surkov, I got the final answer on LED
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (17:13): most approximation algorithms are non-practical
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (17:13): there are two available solutions
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (17:13): one O(min(n,m)*d) where d is the distance (d <= max(n,m))
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (17:14): in linear memory
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (17:14): and O(n + d^2) which is good for very similar strings
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (17:14): and is a bit complex in implementation
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (17:14): I guess I go with the first one
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (17:15): askalski: can you dump your findings into the bug?
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (17:15): I think we should go with 1st
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (17:17): askalski: you would enjoy working in the toronto office i think
